loans.name: Rubia

texts.en: Rubia established Espy Alterations & Boutique 15 years ago as an alterations, dry cleaning and fashion boutique.  She is trying to revamp the business and bring in new services such as dry cleaning pickup and delivery and business to business sales.  Rubia hopes her new marketing strategy will generate more revenue and create a full time job for her current part-time employee. She would like a loan of $5,000 to help with inventory and business improvements.

loans.use: to pay for marketing materials and inventory

loans.name: Agosto Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo  “AGOSTO POTY” tiene 16 integrantes  en donde la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, el trabajo en quipo y utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que sus luchas su mayor fortaleza.
Isis es una persona muy emprendedora y por sobre todo trabajadora, comenta que desde muy joven ha hecho todo tipo de trabajo y ha podido salir adelante. Actualmente vende joyas y también líneas de celulares. Cuenta que la vida es muy difícil por lo que hay que trabajar para seguir.
Su deseo es poder ir creciendo con su negocio y seguir ayudando a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de joyas, con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad nueva que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “AGOSTO POTY” group has 16 members who offer each other constant mutual support and, above all, who inspire each other to continue battling on for their families' sake. They work as a team and use all their available resources so that the struggles that they face make them stronger.
Isis is an enterprising person and, above all, she is hard-working. She has done all kinds of work since an early age in order to get ahead in life. Currently, she sells jewellery and mobile phones. She says that life is very difficult so she has to work hard in order to carry on. Her dream is to be able to grow her business and continue helping her family. She is applying for this loan to invest in buying jewellery so that she has a better new range to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy all kinds of jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for inventory for her new accessory store

loans.name: Afiavi Eleonore

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Eleonore est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont trois vont encore à l'école. Le plus âgé a 25 ans et le moins âgé a 13 ans. Pour son métier du tricotage, elle se fait aider par 03 apprentis et vend aussi de la glace puis des cartes de recharge depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Dans le but d'accroître son pouvoir d'achat et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: 44 years of age, Eleonore is married and the mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. The eldest is 25 years old and the youngest 13 years old. She has three apprentices helping her out in her knitting business. She also has been selling ice and telephone cards for years. She stocks up at one of the local markets. In order to bolster her purchasing power and better respond to customer demand, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev, with the goal of maximizing her additional income and helping with the education expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy 300 rolls of wool yarn.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina, a 60-year-old woman from the town of Loon, Bohol, is married and has five children. She and her husband are engaged in fishing, making dresses, and raising hogs to earn a living.

Working hard so she can provide for her family, Carolina dreams of having a good and comfortable life. She is now requesting a loan to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, a fishing net, fish hooks, and feed for her hogs. Her profits will be used for the family's daily living expenses.

In the future, she would like to expand her business so she can save for old age and retire in comfort.

loans.use: to buy feed and other necessities for her businesses.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
El Antojo is a mobile food preparation truck that has been in operation for four years. They sell healthy, freshly prepared traditional Mexican cuisine. Their food is nutritious and is prepared with white meat chicken, low fat beef, freshly made salsa, lard-free beans and low-fat cheese.  Their delicious tortas (meat sandwiches) are made with wheat bread and light spreads.  They hand make their own lard-free flour tortillas that make the perfect quesadillas and burritos.  Finish off a visit to El Antojo with a yogurt, a salad, or a glass of freshly squeezed juice made from pesticide-free locally grown produce.

Socorro seeks $5,000 to upgrade the food truck to meet health department codes.  The fire sprinklers, ventilation system and sink plumbing need to be upgraded, and a new public health permit needs to be purchased.  She must also purchase new blades for her commercial juicer and ice machine, as well as, obtain a new motor for her freezer and new cutting boards and cutlery.

loans.use: to upgrade the food truck to meet health department codes.

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is a 27-year-old single woman who has two family members from Al Bayader Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for accessories to sell to her friends and neighbors in her area. She hopes in the future to open a shop to increase her family income.

Since Ruba is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to sell

loans.name: The Pachyderm Group

texts.en: The members of The Pachyderm Group have invented a compact, portable device intended for cleaning the soles of shoes. The components of this product are specifically designed to clean away dirt, mud, snow, ice, chewing gum and any other debris picked up during everyday wear and tear. A patent is pending on this amazing product. The owners of the company have many years of experience in research, marketing and conducting business on the internet. The company will use the internet to introduce, market, and advertise their product on Amazon and E-Bay. A website will be set up explaining the product using visual aids with the ability to purchase directly from the website. The Pachyderm Group is seeking $5,000 for production of their product and to pay for the marketing of their product at trade shows and on the internet.

loans.use: to produce their product and to pay for marketing

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. The photo was taken in their house. Noor is a 24-year-old young woman who is married and a mother to three sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Noor is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of painting her house and installing new tiles in order to improve the living conditions in the family's house. Taking this loan will offer Noor and her family suitable home conditions, so the family can enjoy living in their house.


About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To paint the house and install tiles

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en: Ma. Cristina is a 43-year-old woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with three children who are 4, 5 and 13 years old. Ma. Cristina is dependent on her habal-habal business (motorbike used to carry passengers to their destinations) to earn an income for her family. But she is optimistic and willing to persevere. She is asking for a loan to buy spare tires for the motorbike and raw materials like hardwood and steel for her comfort room renovation. Ma. Cristina hopes that with the additional capital, her business will prosper and her home will be more comfortable to live in for her family. She also plans to engage in other business opportunities someday.

loans.use: to buy spare tire for her motorbike and raw materials to renovate her comfort room

loans.name: Atieh

texts.en:
Atieh, who appears in the picture, is a 42-year-old married father of four sons and three daughters; he works in a local restaurant earning a low salary that is insufficient to cover the family's costs and expenses.

Atieh's daughter is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Atieh wants to help his daughter complete her studies, and so is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help his daughter cover her tuition fees. This will ensure a better future for his daughter and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru: Торговая точка Анны расположена в торговом центре «Башни». Она торгует мужской одеждой: светерами, рубашками, джемперами, брюками, джинсами.  Кредит понадобился Анне для закупки осенней мужской одежды. Она хочет приобрести гольфы, светера, теплые брюки и джинсы, а так же шерстянные желетки. У Анны никогда не было проблем по выплатам. Она пунктуальная, вежливая и добропорядочная женщина.
texts.en: Anna's retail outlet is located at the "Bashni" shopping center.  She sells men's clothing, such as sweaters, shirts, cardigans, pants and jeans.  Anna needed this loan to purchase men's autumn clothing.  She wants to buy socks, sweaters, warm pants and jeans, and also wool vests.  Anna never had issues repaying her loans.  She is a punctual, polite and decent woman.

loans.use: to purchase men's autumn clothing, such as socks, sweaters, warm pants, jeans and wool vests

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Nisreen prefers that her photo is not on the Internet. Thus the above photo is of her husband. Nisreen is a 21-year-old married woman who has three family members and is from Sahab Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to buy clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same area. She would like in the future to develop her business to increase her income.
Since Nisreen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 45 years old and from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a fisherman. She has five children, the oldest is 25 and the youngest is 8. She is asking for a loan to help their business. She will use the loan to buy an engine for their fishing boat. She is hopeful that this will contribute to the productivity of their fishing busniess. She hopes that in the future, she can make a bigger profit out of her business. The income generated will provide her family with a healthy diet and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her husband's fishing boat.

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru: У нее все прекрасно, и лицо и душа и мысли и осталось сделать прекрасной только ее одежду, в котором можете помочь только Вы, уважаемые кредиторы. Ее зовут Рохила и ей 20 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Рохила решила помочь родителям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес с вышиванием вышивки, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она делает красивые вышивки в национальных платьях. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки машинки для вышивки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Everything is fine with her - face and soul and thoughts, and only her clothing remains to become fine, which only you, respected creditors, can help her with.  Her name is Rohila and she is 20 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Rohila decided to help her parents in order to improve the family's welfare.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women and obtained a certificate.  Now, she can organize her own business and become successful at it.  She wants to start an embroidery business because she has experience in this type of business.  She makes beautiful embroidery on national dresses.  Rohila is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase an embroidery machine in order to organize her new business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine in order to organize her new business

loans.name: Osama

texts.en: Osama is a 50-year-old married man who supports four family members and is from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 700 JD to pay for his home improvements. He would like to do maintenance on the home and to do repainting. In the future, he wants to increase his economic status.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Iman prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Iman is a 31 year old married woman who has two family members. She is from Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements to do maintenance and repaint the house. In the future she hopes to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ashuraly

texts.ru: Не хотите ли вы помочь таксисту, который является мастером своего дела. Его зовут Ашурали и ему 59 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5  детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами  3 года назад он начала свой бизнес. Он имеет свою машину и работает таксистом. Его машина имеет 10 пассажирских мест. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, он обладает широким кругом клиентов. Он должен отремонтировать свою машину, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для ремонта машины. Он надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Wouldn’t you like to help out  a taxi driver who really knows his job? His name is Ashuraly, and he is 59 years old. He is married and bringing up five children.  He launched this business three years ago in order to support his family. He owns a car and works as a taxi driver. His car has 10 passenger seats. Thanks to his high-quality service he has a wide customer base. He needs to repair his car but lacks the necessary means. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 TJS for car repairs. He is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a 36 year old married woman from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She has four children ages 4, 11, 13 and 15. 

Margarita makes dish-washing liquid for an income. She works hard for her children's needs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy the detergent powder and conditioner necessary for her business. The income that she will generate will help pay for school fees and meals for the family. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business venture, so she can have a better chance of a good income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy detergent powder and conditioner to make dish-washing liquid to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 43 year old married woman who has four family members She is from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for materials for embroidery, such as fabric, beads and silk. In the future she would like to open a shop to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for emboidery

loans.name: Rimaa

texts.en:
Rimaa is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past year, he has had a barber shop, which has been a profitable project. He has a good reputation among his customers. This is his only source of income.

Rimaa is requesting a $2,500 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of making some improvements to the barber shop such as painting, installing mirrors and purchasing some furniture. This will attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To improve his barber shop.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Maria Auxiliadora es de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 2º ciclo con 10 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esfuerzan en salir adelante y luchan por sus hijos.
La Sra. Ricarda es una de las miembros, se dedica a la elaboración de frazadas y hamacas y los vende con la ayuda de su marido .Ella está  muy contenta y orgullosa por formar parte de la Fundación Paraguaya y del programa de Comités de Mujeres Emprendedoras y ve en esto una gran ayuda para ella y su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos para poder hacer sus hamacas y frazadas.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora Committee is located in the city of Carapegua. They are currently in their second cycle with 10 members who are all hardworking women that work to get ahead and provide for their children.
Ricarda is one of the committee's members. She works making blankets and hammocks which she sells with the help of her husband. She is very happy and proud to be a member of the Fundacion Paraguaya  and to work with the Comites de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Female Entrepreneurs), from which she and her family receive a great deal of support.
She is applying for the loan in order to purchase linens and supplies which she will use to make her hammocks and blankets.

loans.use: to purchase linens.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old, married, and a mother of five children, ages 2 to 16. She is from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. 

Nipa trees grows mostly near the rivers of Maribojoc. Veronica has been engaged in making nipa huts for five years now.  Nipa huts are widely used by people who want to have a comfortable house. Nipa huts make a cool and comfortable home. Nipa is commonly used as a roof. 

Veronica earns her income weaving nipa leaves. She is asking for a loan to buy more nipa leaves that she can weave. Her profit will help send her children to school. In the future, she hopes to have other business options for a better income to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more nipa leaves to process.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité   Primavera  se originó a traves de promociones  hechas a las miembros, el objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa y así ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra.  Estanislaa es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, cuenta que su trabajo es la cría y venta de chanchos. Nos dice que su trabajo es muy duro, ya que las 24 horas debe de estar pendiente de sus animales y cuidar que no les pase nada. Comenta que su sueño es poder tener una gran granja y poder criar otro tipo de animales y así tener mayores ingresos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para cerdo, con lo cual podrá seguir alimentando a sus animales y que tengan asi un buen porte para la venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primavera" was formed as a result of outreach efforts to its members.  All of the members have the goal of working hard, creating a spirit of solidarity within the group and reaching the maximum level of the program so that they can help their families.

Estanislaa is a very hardworking woman who makes a great deal of sacrifice.  She reports that her work is in the raising and selling of pigs.  She says that her work is very hard, since she has to be available 24 hours a day to watch over her animals and make sure nothing happens to them.  She adds that her dream is to be able to have a large farm and be able to raise other types of animals, which would lead to an increase in income.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy feed for her pigs, with which she will be able to continue feeding them and ensure that they reach a good weight so that she can sell them.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, tiene una hija. Ella se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas y al comercio de productos de primera necesidad; vive junto a su hija, ya que es madre soltera. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. a preparar el desayuno, luego se dirige junto a su hija a trabajar al terreno donde tienen sus cultivos por la mañana, dejando a una sobrina encargada de atender su pequeña tienda.  

Los productos que vende en su tienda, los adquiere cada 8 días en una ciudad que para llegar ahí debe caminar a pie dos kilómetros y luego aborda un autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo es, para comprar dos vacas lecheras. Con las nuevas vacas, podrá obtener leche para vender y para elaborar queso fresco, crema y venderla en su tienda. Su objetivo es reparar el techo de su casa, por la razón que es de lamina y cuando llueve se moja el producto de su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old and has a daughter. She makes a living through agricultural work and the sale of domestic staples. She lives with her daughter since she is a single mother. She wakes up at 4:30 a.m. to prepare breakfast, then heads with her daughter to work the land where they have their crops during the morning, leaving a niece in charge of attending her small shop.

The products that she sells in her store she acquires every eight days in a city that to get to she has to walk two kilometers on foot and then board a bus.

The loan that she is applying for from Fundación Campo is to buy two dairy cows. With the new cows, she will be able to obtain milk to sell and to produce fresh cheese and sour cream, and sell them in her shop. Her objective is to repair the roof of her house, for the reason that it’s made of metal and when it rains the products in her shop get wet.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: La Garita Group

texts.es: Verónica tiene 20 años de edad y esta  casada con el señor Florentino ellos tienen un hijo pequeño, ella es parte del grupo La Garita y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque así se llama la localidad donde vive, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y niños y dice que  tiene con su negocio desde hace mas de dos años y que le va muy bien por que casi vende toda la ropa cada vez que surte, dice que ella va a la Ciudad de México donde le dan bajos precios para ella poderle ganar algo a la hora de venderlos, dice que emprendió este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y que se su esposo la ayuda a ir a surtir y a vender la ropa con las esposas de sus conocidos y amigos. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a Vision Fund para seguir invirtiendo en mallones, pantalones de mezclilla. Blusas, trajecitos para niños etc. Dice que le servirá de mucho porque asi tendrá muy bien surtido su negocio. Las otras 12 personas del grupo se llaman Carolina, Rosa Linda, Clara, Liliana, Ma Socorro, Rosa, Arizbeida, Silvia, Yessica, María de los Ángeles, M Natividad y Elizabeth ellas invertirán en sus negocios de venta de zapatos por catalogo, por ropa para vender, material para sastrería, en una pollería, en un club nutricional, en una bonetería y mercería y en antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Veronica is 20 years old and is married to Florentino. They have a small son. She is part of the La Garita group and says the they chose this name because this is the name of the area where they live. She makes a living selling women's and children's clothing and says that she has had her business for more than two years. It it going very well for her because she sells almost all the clothing that she stocks.

She says that she is going to Mexico City where they give low prices so that she can earn something when she sells them. She says she began this business to help her husband with the household expenses and that her husband helps her to stock and sell the clothing to the wives of his acquaintances and friends. 

She is requesting a loan to Vision Fund to continue investing in mallones and pants of mixed styles, blouses and small suits for children. She says that it will serve her well because in this way she will have her business very well stocked. The other 12 members of the group are Carolina, Rosa Linda, Clara, Liliana, Ma Socorro, Rosa, Arizbeida, Silvia, Yessica, Maria de los Angeles, M Natividad y Elizabeth. They will invest in their businesses selling shoes by catalog, clothing sales, seamstress material, a poultry shop, a nutritional club, a hosiery and sewing supply shop and in Mexican snacks.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Чурабек проживает в районе Яван. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Чурабек занимается торговлей. Он занимается реализацией продуктов питания. У Чурабека имеется продуктовый магазин. Торговлей он занимается три года. Чурабек берет кредит для покупки необходимых продуктов, чтобы обеспечить жителей своей махаллы (чтобы жители смогли найти и купить необходимые продукты не выезжая).
texts.en: Jurabek lives in Yavan. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. Jurabek works in retail and sells groceries in his own grocery store. He has worked in retail for three years. Jurabek is taking out a loan to purchase groceries for resale so that he can provide for the needs of the locals (so that there is no need to travel outside the village to purchase essential groceries.)

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his store

loans.name: Las Pasionarias Group

texts.es:
El comite Las Pasionarias tiene 14 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma sacar de necesidades a sus familias.
Julia forma parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, y por medio de su trabajo procura dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante y tener una vida digna. Ella es un ejemplo a seguir por todo el apoyo que siempre da a sus amigas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, con los cuales podrá seguir haciendo su trabajo y brindando buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Las Pasionarias committee has 14 members. They are all friends and neighbors in the city of San Lorenzo. They came together for the purpose of helping each other and meet their families' needs. 

Julia is part of this group. She works as a seamstress and through her work she gives her family everything they need to advance and have a dignified life. She is a example to be followed because of all the support that she always gives her friends. She is applying for the loan to buy fabrics and thread, with which she will be able to continue with her work and provide good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread for her sewing shop.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор живет и работает в городе Мелитополе. Он занимается производством бетонно-керамических изделий и предоставляет разного рода строительные услуги. У него есть 3 стройбригады по отделочным работам и еще 2 человека отдельно занимаются производством бетонно-керамических ваз с элементами ковки. 
Виктору необходим кредит в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить материалы для изготовления бетонно--керамических конструкций и развивать дальше это производство для последующей реализации изделий в сфере строительства.
texts.en:
Viktor lives and works in the city of Melitopol. He fabricates parts from ceramic cement and also performs other construction services. Viktor manages three construction teams who work on detailing and also employs two men who fabricate ceramic cement vases with elements of forging.

Viktor requires a loan of 21000 griven to purchase raw materials for ceramic cement construction and to further develop this part of his business for future resale to the local construction industry.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for ceramic cement construction

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.ru:
Мирослава живет в Хусте, Западная Украина. Она работает в одном из местных магазинов канцтоваров. Ее все знают как добросовестную и трудолюбивую женщину, которая всегда последовательна в своих решениях. 
Мирослава обратилась в КИВА за суммой в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы доделать ремонт дома, купив заказную мебель для кухни, а именно врезную варочную панель и духовку. Мирослава – женя и мама, поэтому ей много времени приходится проводить на кухне. Поэтому она очень хочет обустроить именно кухню, чтобы в квартире добавилось уюта и тепла.
texts.en:
Miroslava lives in Khoost, West Ukraine. She works at the local office supply store. Everyone knows Miroslava as a conscientious and hard working woman who is always dependable in her decisions. 

Miroslava has turned to Kiva for a loan of 5000 griven so that she can complete repairs in her house and purchase custom cabinets for her kitchen, specifically a stove top and an oven. Miroslava is a wife and a mother, and she spends a lot of time in her kitchen. For this reason she wants to improve her kitchen and bring more warmth and coziness to her home.

loans.use: to finish repairing her house, purchase kitchen furniture, specifically a stove top and an oven.

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.ru:
Иванна – предприниматель из Хуста. Она уже несколько лет торгует на рынке резиновой и спортивной обувью, а также детскими колготками, носками и бельем. У нее есть один наемный рабочий. Иванне постоянно приходится сталкиваться с проблемой конкуренции на рынке, но она нашла выход из положения. Иванна разработала выгодную систему скидок для постоянных покупателей. 
Иванна планирует вложить кредит от КИВА в размере 4 000 гривен в приобретение партии спортивных кед, которые сейчас пользуются спросом среди молодежи, тем самым пополнив свои оборотные средства.
texts.en:
Ivanna is a businesswoman from Khoost. She has worked in retail for a few years and sells rubber boots and sneakers, as well as children tights, socks and underwear. She employs another helper in her business. Ivanna is in constant competition with other retailers on the market, but she has found a good solution: Ivanna has a lucrative system of discounts for regular customers.

Ivanna plans to invest her 4000 griven loan from Kiva into purchasing a batch of sneakers which are popular among the young people this fall, and will be able to increase her purchasing capital as the result.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of sneakers that are in demand this season

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila, whose husband is shown here, is a 43-year-old married woman who supports five family members in Jarash, Jordan. For cultural reasons, Jamila would prefer that her photo not appear on the Internet. Jamila is engaged in a sewing business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,300 JD, which will allow her to buy sewing materials such as fabric, beads, and silk. 

Jamila would like eventually to expand into new sewing projects. In the future, she hopes to show her products in the Jarash shops. In addition, she plans eventually to open a supermarket business.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabric, beads, and silk

loans.name: Oysara

texts.ru: Ойсара 57 лет. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она старается обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами.  Более 35 лет она работает инженером, но ее зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи с новыми технологиями. Она решила организовать новый бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oysara is 57 years old. She is a widow and has raised three children. She tries her best to provide for her children and has worked as an engineer for 35 years, but her salaray is not enough to purchase new electronics for the family. Oysara decided to start a new business to help her family. She attended a class "Be successful" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to start a business reselling cattle. For this purpose Oysara is taking out a loan of 1000 somoni to purchase calves for her new business. Oysara waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita  tiene 60 años,  es viuda con 1 hijos ya independientes, ella se dedica al comercio de carne de pollo en su carnicería que se encuentran en uno de los mercados de la zona sur,  este préstamo es su sexta  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Benita es cliente antigua de la institución, la Sra. Benita va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un congelador grande para conservar sus productos en buen estado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que requiere la congeladora para la venta de carne., la Sra. Benita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías en la zona, pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de otra congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Benita is 60 years old, a widow with one son who is already independent. She makes a living by selling chicken in her butcher shop that is in one of the markets in the southern zone. 

This loan is her sixth sequence in this institution. Benita is a long-standing client of the institution. Benita is going to use this loan to buy a large freezer to preserve her products in a good state. Her reason for applying for this loan is that she requires the freezer to sell the meat. Benita faces the challenge of competition in her business since there are various butcher shops in the zone, but she has many customers because of the kindness with which she treats her clientele. She is going to utilize the benefits to buy another large freezer. Her wish for her business is to have a stable and profitable business and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make jewelry and to market his business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria,la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud,la socia vende de forma independiente ofreciendo a sus amistades y clientes que le solicitan,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a la venta de granos secos como maiz,la socia vende en Ollantaytambo los fienes de semana en ferias,la socia lleva buen tiempo en sus negocios gracias al empeño que le pone a cada uno de ellos,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de productos naturales para su negocio.


 La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Victoria is continuing in her business selling natural health products.  She works independently, offering her goods to her friends and customers who come to her.  At the same time she is also continuing to sell dry goods such as corn.  She works in markets in Ollantaytambo on weekends.  Things are going well in her businesses thanks to the efforts she puts into each of them.  She is a responsible person and works very hard, since this is what it takes to help her family get ahead.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy natural products for her business.  She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to complete her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his wife and his ill son appear in his Kiva profile photo.

Adnan is a Palestinian man.   He is married and is a father to one son and one daughter.  He is a construction worker who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's costs and expenses. 

Adnan is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him pay his son's medical expenses, who is five years old and suffering from troubles and pain in his eyes. This will improve Adnan's son health to better and enable him to live in normal conditions with his family.

loans.use: to cover his son's medical expenses

loans.name: Badrah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Badrah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Badrah is a 32-year-old married woman who has 5 family members.  She is from Bani Kenanah Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to do maintenance, repaint her home and to buy new furniture. In the future she is planning on adding another floor and she hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: pay for home improvements

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo and is pictured with his herd.

Leena is a 30-year-old young woman.  She is married and is a mother to one son.   Her husband is a worker and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Leena and her husband have also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Leena is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing more sheep and more fodder to feed the sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: buy more sheep and fodder

loans.name: Feda'a

texts.en: Feda'a is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan, who has 5 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements.   She would like to do maintenance and repainting of her home. In the future she hopes to increase her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 29-year-old young man.  He is married and is father to two daughters.   He is employed and earns low salary, and his wife has a sewing workshop for sewing clothes for customers.

For the past five years, Alaa has had a greenhouse planting different types of seedlings.  This has been a profitable project but also needs more support to cover the cost.  

Alaa is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing seasonal seedlings to plant in the greenhouse. This will allow Alaa to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve his family's income.

Alaa is photographed inside his greenhouse.

loans.use: buy seedlings

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a 45-year-old married woman who has 3 family members from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She wants to do maintenance for her home. In the future she would like to improve her social status.

loans.use: pay for home improvements

loans.name: Jose Alex

texts.en:
Jose Alex is a 33-year-old from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. He is married and has two children, ages 10 and 11.  Jose Alex grows rice and also buys  and sells Nipa leaves for an income.  Nipa leaves are woven and used as a roof for some households.  

Jose Alex is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings, and to pay for labor and buy more nipa leaves.  His profit helps in sending his children to school.  In the future, he hopes to build his own house for his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seedlings, nipa leaves and pay for labor

loans.name: Yahia

texts.en: Yahia is a 51-year-old married man who has 4 family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 700 JOD to pay for his home improvements.  He wants to do maintenance and repainting of his home. In the future he would like to improve his living standard.

loans.use: pay for home improvements

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and is from Maribojoc, a town in Bohol. She is married and has two grown children.  Teresita operates a sari-sari store and an eatery for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy candies, canned goods, chips, toiletries, seasonings, liquor, softdrinks and kitchen utensils.  These items will help boost Teresita's income. Her profit will be used to buy food for her family and reinvest in her business.  

In the future, Teresita hopes to make her place bigger and to sell items that she does not previously carry.

loans.use: restock her store and eatery business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, who lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya, is married and has one child. He owns a barber shop which he has been operating for three years.

Christopher learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group; he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are debts and high rent.

Christopher is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase barber shop stock such as spirits, shavers etc. The extra income arising from the loan will be added to his savings to pay school fees for his children and improve his living standard. His dream is to open another barber shop in the area.

loans.use: to purchase barber shop stock such as spirits, shavers, etc.

loans.name: Gavin

texts.en:
While most of his contemporaries were concentrating on college graduation or finding a job, 22-year-old Gavin, along with his partner Jeremy, decided to open a men's vintage clothing shop. Hello Boys, located in Nashville, is a "sister" store to Goodbuy Girls, which is owned and operated by close friends of Gavin and Jeremy. 

A determined and self-motivated person, Gavin had the idea to open a consignment shop, found an available place, purchased inventory, redecorated what used to be an office, established a website and opened his store , all within two months. He designed the boutiquestyle store to have shadow boxes that showcase merchandise and allow customers to see the fashionable and complete outfits.
 
After acquiring a loan from Accion in the Delta, Gavin paid for shelving, the store's first month's rent and deposit and other supplies. He credits the loan for allowing the doors of Hello Boys to open on August 10. After his first weekend of business, they had to temporarily close the shop because they sold out of the majority of their inventory and needed time to replenish.  But doors are open again!  (And word is spreading rapidly about the exciting new venture. Gavin reports that legendary musician Elvis Costello and his family recently paid a visit to the shop.)

Hello Boys also helps sustain jobs. Gavin hired a local artist to help design the store's layout, make the color choices and paint the space. He also contributes to the success of others by selling shirts created by local entrepreneurs. 

For more info about the company, visit www.facebook.com/helloboysnashville.  A new website will be coming soon:  www.helloboysnashville.com.

loans.use: To pay for rent and materials for his store.

loans.name: Isel

texts.es:
El Sr. Isel tiene un negocio familiar que es la venta de mochilas, calzados, prendas y demás en la zona del Mercado Municipal, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 15 años, su local está ubicado en un lugar muy recurrido por la gente, por lo que tiene muy buena clientela y le va muy bien.
Él es muy emprendedor, comento que le gusta mucho ayudarles a las personas más necesitadas y que además su objetivo es llegar a tener un local propio y así seguir creciendo.
 Solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados y prenda, con lo que podrá surtirse y dar una mayor variedad a sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Isel has a family business selling backpacks, footwear, garments and other items in the municipal market area. He has had this business for more than 15 years. His shop is located in a busy area so that he has many fine customers and it is doing well.

He is very enterprising and notes that he loves to help people in need. His goal, as well, is to have his own shop and thus continue growing. He is requesting a loan to purchase footwear and garments and provide his customers with a greater variety of inventory. He is grateful for the help he is receiving.

loans.use: to purchases shoes and garments.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: For the borrower's privacy, this loan has become anonymous.

loans.use: For the borrower's privacy, this loan has become anonymous

loans.name: Hien's Group

texts.en:
Hien is 46 years old. She has three adult children. She sells noodles and rice for a living. From her small business, Hien gains 3,500,000 VND a month. She has taken part in SEDA's loan program since 2011. In her last loan cycle, Hien borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy more noodles and rice to sell. She wants to improve her family's living standards.

Other members which are part of Hien's Group include the following:
- Hien - Hien is 33 years old. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to sell pork salad 
- Huong - Huong is 27 years old. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to recycle metal scrap
- Thuong - Thuong is 26 years old. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to raise chickens for sale
- Nga - Nga is 31 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to improve her family's living standards

loans.use: to buy more noodles and rice to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel, 34 years old and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a mother to her child. By the grace of God, Pelagia has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to sustain their expenses.

Raquel has a modular design business.  It is an approach that subdivides a system (for example, a room in the office) into smaller parts (modules) that can be independently created and then used in different systems to drive multiple business uses.  She earns a minimum of PHP 50,000 monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy wood, hinges and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Raquel dreams of expanding her business soon, just as she wants her child to graduate from college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for wood, hinges and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah lives in Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. 

She owns a retail shop that she has been operating for six years.  She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are lack of funds and competition. 

Lydiah is applying for a loan of KES 41,850 to buy sugar, wheat and maize flour, and cereals. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family. 

Her dream is to expand and open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat and maize flour, and cereals.

loans.name: Dúo Gracia Y Bendición Group

texts.es:
Dúo Gracia Y bendición.
Este Grupo está conformado por la señora teresa, de 32 años de edad ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, y también a la venta de chicharrones este último solo cuando hay días de mercado, ella tiene 3 hijos y están estudiando por tal razón necesitan trabajar fuerte para darles lo necesario a sus hijos, ya que el sueño de ella es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de harina para la elaboración de pan para la venta.
texts.en:
"Dúo Gracia y Bendición" ["Grace and Blessings Duo"] includes Teresa, who is 32 years old and works making and selling bread, as well as selling chicharrones (the latter only on market days). She has three children who are in school. That is the reason she needs to work hard, so she can give her children what they need; her dream is for her children to continue with their studies. 

Teresa is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour to make bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy flour to make bread, and to buy chicharrones to sell.

loans.name: Milven

texts.en:
Milven is 21 years old, single, and living in the Philippines.
Milven is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 to  pay for the maintenance  like change engine oil and  buy  tires for the motorcycle for transportation business.
Milven has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Milven hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance  and buy tires of motorcycle for transportation business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. She is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Rosario requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods to sell. In the future, Rosario hopes to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice selling and pig fattening. Analiza is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like biscuits, soft-drinks, rice and other groceries.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, soft-drinks, rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 45, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pablito and a mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a five peso's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to expand her business. She dreams of giving her family a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita.  She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories of her motorcycle units. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal house hold and business expenditures. 

Mercedita would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy more spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her motorcycles. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses for her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedita hopes to add more motorcycles to her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy embroidery threads and tea leaf packets at wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married, and has three children. She owns a retail shop, which she has been operating for 5 years.

She learned about Milango through friends, who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is customers not paying on time. 

Mwanajuma is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal and coconut. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings.  

Her dream is to see her business grow, live a stable, comfortable life with her family, and purchase a vehicle to transport the farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal and coconut.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: La Sra.  Herminia tiene 41 años, casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 21, 19 y 18 años todos se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, La Sra. Herminia  se dedica  a la venta de joyas enchapadas en oro en su joyería que se encuentra ubicado en una de las calles más populares de la ciudad del  Alto este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Herminia va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de  variedad de joyas por mayor  y así ofrecer variedad de joyas a sus clientes  y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Herminia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Sra. Herminia is 41 years old and married with three children, who are 21, 19 and 18 years of age. All are studying at the university. 

Herminia sells gold-plated jewelry in her jewelry store, which is located on one of the most popular streets in the city of Alto. This is her second loan from Emprender and she is going to use it to purchase an assortment of jewelry wholesale and thus offer more variety to her customers. Consequently, she will give her clients better service and increase her profits. The reason she is requesting this loan is so she can continue improving her business. 

Hermina is a very hardworking person and is happy at the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca tiene 57 años sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, ella se dedica desde hace muchos años al servicio de reciclaje de botellas y envases en el acopio que se encuentran en su misma casa de donde distribuye a las distintas empresas, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Francisca  va a usar este préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio botellas y envases de plástico y vidrio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar sus ganancias y por ende su capital, la Sra. francisca enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que muchas personas al igual que ella se dedican al reciclado de materiales, ella va a utilizar los beneficios compra de mas material para su negocio. la sueña por su negocio es tener un acopio más grande de reciclaje.
texts.en: Francisca is 57-years-old and her children are all independent adults now.  She has been working collecting bottles and packaging materials to recycle at home that she then sells to various firms.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Francisca is going to use it to buy merchandise like plastic and glass bottles and packaging.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase her profits and thus her capital.  Francisca’s business challenge is competition because there are many people like her who work recycling materials.  She will use profits to buy material for her business.  Her dream for her business is to gather up much more for recycling.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery Items (like oil, rice, sugar)

loans.name: Oktofianus

texts.en:
Oktofianus is a 41-year-old man who is married to Ana. From his marriage, he has been blessed with three children: Winda, 16, is attending 1st grade of senior high school; Wanda, 12, is attending 5th grade of elementary school; and Henokh, 10, is attending 3rd grade of elementary school. 

Oktofianus runs a furniture business near his house. He produces furniture such as desks, chairs, cupboards, shelves, and also coffins based on the orders from his customers. The income earned from the business enables him to cover his family's needs. At the moment, he needs to complete an order from a customer, but the lack of capital became a challenge for him in completing the order. He then submitted the loan application and requested a loan of 4,500,000 IDR from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on basic materials such as wood and a new wood plane.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as wood and a new wood plane.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila is 29 years old and married with 1 child. She wants to start a small business making and selling woven hats, woven mats, design boards, and crafts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy paints, wood, panadanus leaves, feathers, cutting tools, and design tools. In the future, Otila hopes to improve her business to help her family and educate her child. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, wood, panadanus leaves, feathers, cutting tools, and design tools.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 47 years old and married with two children who are in school. Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Amalia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, sardines, junk food, drinks etc.

In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
Noraida is 25 years old and single. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Noraida has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.


Noraida is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a 37-year-old married female from Sahab in Jordan. 

She had requested a 499 JOD loan to pay for clothes and cosmetics to sell. 

She is looking forward to expanding her project and improving her family's situation.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene 28 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  14 años y un bebe de  4 meses, ella se dedica a la venta de toros, ella vende en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vive por la zona de Villa Salome, y tiene  a su ganado en la cumbre en un terreno que ella tiene, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Cristina va a usar este préstamo para reparación de movilidad para su negocio ya que esta le permite transportar su ganado a las distintas ferias, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejoramiento de transporte, la Sra. Cristina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la poca demanda en ocasiones ya sea por problemas de clima o de transporte, ella va a utilizar los beneficios reparando el motor de su movilidad y desea con el tiempo poder comprar un camión de mayor capacidad para poder transportar mayor cantidad de ganado, en la foto la Sra. Cristina se encuentra en compañia de sus hijito mayor.
texts.en: Cristina, 28, is married and has two children who are 14 and 4 months of age.  She sells bulls in various street markets in the city of La Paz.  She lives around Villa Salome and keeps her cattle upland on a piece of land she owns.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Cristina will use it to repair her business vehicle since it’s what makes it possible for her to transport her cattle to the various markets.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to improve transportation.  The business challenge Cristina faces is drop in demand due either to weather conditions or transportation.  She will use the profits to repair her vehicle’s engine and hopes in time to buy a truck with larger capacity to transport a larger number of cattle.  In the photo, Cristina appears with her older son.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf, who appears in the picture, is a Palestinian young man.   He is married and a father to four sons.  He is employed and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.
Ashraf is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer to Ashraf and his family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase living room furniture

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Lubna prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.
Lubna is a 25 year-old married female from Sahab in Jordan.  She has 4 children and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvements and painting.  In the future, she would like to do more improvements and buy some furniture.

Since Lubna is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Gustava

texts.en:
Gustava is a 41-year-old woman who is married with two children. She has a small sewing business and elei fabric printed materials. She has one year in the business. Gustava needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles and thread, etc. She will use her profits to pay for her children's school fees. 

Gustava joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and needles and thread.

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en:
Fatemah is a 24 year-old married female from Sahab in Jordan.  She has two children and requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for painting and buying furniture for her home.  In the future, she is looking forward to improving the looks of her home and making further improvements.

Since Fatemah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Las 10 integrantes del grupo son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, se unieron con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Diana es miembro de este grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy apreciadas por sus clientes y eso le ayuda mucho a seguir creciendo.
Diana solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y ganando los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The ten members of this group are very hardworking and enterprising.  They joined together with the purpose of working together and by means of this work help each other out.  Diana is a member of the group and she relates that she works selling all types of food.  She says that she has a good clientele because her dishes are very much enjoyed by her customers and this helps her to continue to grow.  Diana is asking for the loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients to continue working and earning income needed to help her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: Jose, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y cuatro hijos en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. don Jose se dedica  a la venta de verduras desde hace 12 años, el tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado de la Ciudad, donde vende zanahoria, remolacha, chile verde, tomate, repollo, papas, cebolla y otros al detalle y al por mayor. Para surtir y hacer crecer el negocio ha solicitado un préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras, para comprar todo tipo de verduras y legumbres. Espera incrementar las ventas y los ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio y hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: José, 43, lives with his spouse and four children in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  José has been selling vegetables for the last 12 years.  He has a sales stand in a market in the city where he sells carrots, beets, green chilies, tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, onions and others at retail and wholesale.  In order to stock up he needs an 11,000 Lempira loan to buy all sorts of vegetables and legumes.  He hopes to increase sales and income to support his children’s schooling and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and legumes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery frame, thread, and embroidery material

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 39 year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and is raising 4 children with her husband. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Mariam is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Mariam has 6 years experience with the little sewing and tailoring business.  To improve her work conditions she would like to renew her work area. To pay for the renovation work, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 19 year-old single male from Al Bayader - Amman in Jordan.  He has requested a 700 JOD loan to pay for retailing in mobile phones and cards.  He is looking forward to opening his own shop in the future.

Since Mohammed is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for retailing in mobile phones and cards

loans.name: Chro's Group

texts.en:
Chro is 29 years old and is married with one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Chro is one of  many Iraqi woman who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Chro has 5 years of experience with her little home-based sewing and tailoring business, which she is continuously trying to improve. In the past, Chro took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and some small furniture items. Having successfully repaid the loan, she is now taking a new loan to make further improvements, this time focusing on her work conditions. She took a loan to update her work area by repainting her walls, and she would also like to buy an overlook sewing machine (serger).  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to update her work area by repainting the walls and buying an overlook sewing machine (serger).

loans.name: Amad

texts.en: Amad is a 21 year- old single young man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  He has been operating a bookstore with phone accessories, selling mobile charges, recharge cards and mobile phones to his customers. He has been involved in this kind of business for one year. He opened this business with the help of his father. Amad is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB Bank, which he will use to purchase mobile recharge cards, mobiles and supplies for his bookstore to sell to his customers. He needs the loan to purchase more goods for the shop to meet the demands of his clients. In the future, he hopes to be a successful merchant in order to have retails stores and get married.

loans.use: to purchase mobile recharge cards, mobiles and supplies for his bookstore

loans.name: Amaris Del Carmen

texts.es: Amarís de 53 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos alimenticios o pasabocas empacados llamados mecatos. En su oferta rutinaria de productos, ha observado que necesita surtir en esta temporada con una mayor variedad de estos, para lograr que sus ventas se incrementen, pero no  es fácil tener todo el capital de trabajo que se necesita para aumentar su oferta, por eso ha acudido a un credikiva,  el cual es su primer financiamiento en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará frutas de la cosecha actual y productos alimenticios empacados como papas, chitos, boliquesos, etc. Su negocio inició desde hace muchos años, cuando con el afán de ser independiente comenzó esta actividad cuando su hija tenía 6 años de edad. Con su negocio aumentó los ingresos de su hogar, conformado por su esposo y su hija, hoy en la edad de 33 años. Sus ventas las realiza directamente al consumidor final y las hace de contado, durante todos los días, en los cuales trabaja 8 horas diarias. Su principal mercado son estudiantes de colegios cercanos y vecinos del sector  que potencializan su venta, con la que apoya sus ingresos. Su sueño de tener casa propia  llevan  a Amarís a  trabajar persistentemente en ampliar su negocio, para conseguir  este propósito que es hoy su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Amarís, 53, sells fruit and packaged food items, or snacks, called “mecatos.”  She’s noticed in her usual offer of products that she needs to stock up this season with a wider variety of them so that her sales will increase but it’s not easy to have all the cash needed to increase her inventory which is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy seasonal fruit and packaged food items like potatoes, Cheetos, cheese puffs, etc.

Her business started years ago when she wanted to be independent and her daughter was six-years-old.  She increased income for her home consisting of her husband and daughter who today is 33 years of age.  She sells directly to the final consumer and her sales are cash.  She works every day for 8 hours daily.  Her main market is students from nearby schools and local neighbors who buy from her thus supporting her income.  Her dream of owning a house leads Amarís to work persistently to expand the business in order to reach this goal which is her great challenge for now.

loans.use: to buy season fruit and packaged food items.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn , 44, is married with five children, two (one daughter and one son) of whom are dependent and still in school. Her family lives in a rural village of Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. The main source of the family’s income is from corn planting while her husband also complements the income by working for others for fee. Involving in this business for five years, she is able to earn about 30,000KHR per day and manage to save around 20,000KHR each day. Insufficient of water supply and working capital for supporting her business are the main challenge for her. 

This is the first microloan for Yoeurn with VisionFund. She is requesting for a loan with VisionFund of US$1,000. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation and use a portion of loan to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow good quality corn so as to fulfill her dream of expanding the current business and improve her standard of living, especially, her children can be in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Yenny;La socia continua con su negocio de botica,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia ,la socia trabaja de lunes a sabado desde las 08:00am hasta las 08:00pm,la socia vende medicinas,jarabes entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el credito para la compra de mercaderia como jarabes para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yenny is continues with her drug store business. She has been in this business for a long time, and it is going very well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her work.  She works Mondays through Saturdays from 8am until 8pm.  She sells medicines, syrups, and other items.  She is a responsible and hardworking person who relies on this business to provide for her family.

Yenny is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as syrups, for her business.

She is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as syrups, for her business

loans.name: Eduardo Luis

texts.es: Eduardo compró verduras y frutas con las que generó mayor rotación de sus productos. Hoy está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente,  porque hay un mayor volumen de pedidos en el centro de la ciudad, lugar donde se encuentra ya posicionado y la demanda es mayor; con este crédito comprará verdura y frutas a un mayor volumen, con ello aumentará la oportunidad de obtener descuentos y aumentar rápidamente sus ventas,  generando cada vez mas ingresos que beneficien a su familia.  Él dice a sus financiadores de Kiva  : “Gracias por aprobarme el crédito. “
texts.en: Eduardo bought fruit and vegetables that he used to generate a greater turnover of products.  Today, he’s applying for a Kiva loan once again because he has a larger number of orders downtown which is a spot where he’s already staked out a position and demand is higher.  He will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables in larger amounts to increase the opportunity for volume discounts and quickly increase his sales thereby generating more income each time to benefit his family.  He says to Kiva lenders: “Thanks for approving my loan.”

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables in larger amounts.

loans.name: Ross Mere

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Ross Mere; continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche,aceite entre otros,la socia reparte a sus clientes que mas le solicitan com tiendad de abarrotes y tiendas pequeñas ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para compra arroz al por mayor.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ross Mere is continuing with her business selling consumer staples.  She has had this business for quite some time, and it is going very well thanks to the daily effort she puts into the business.  She sells rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, and other items.  She distributes her products to her customers, who own grocery stores and small stores.  Ross Mere is a responsible and hardworking person who supports her family through this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice at wholesale.

Ross Mere is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy rice at wholesale

loans.name: Tejedoras De Mactzul I Group

texts.es:
