La señora Sebastiana es madre soltera, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica a la confección de blusa y a la venta de la misma, inicio este negocio, gracias al apoyo de su señora madre y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos y telas para mejorar el volumen de producción que realiza, espera seguir aumentando su producción de blusa, ya que en el futuro espera contar con un local propio para hacer la venta de su blusas que realiza. Las demás integrantes se dedican también a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Sebastiana, 27, is a single mother.  She completed fourth grade and has a son who is attending school.  She makes blouses to sell.  She started this business thanks to help from her mother and to date has 10 years’ experience.  

She organized a group in order to request a loan that she’ll use to buy thread and fabric to increase the volume of her production.  She hopes to continue enlarging blouse production and in the future have a space of her own in which to sell the blouses she makes.  The other group members also work in crafts.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Abdulmoamn is 33 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He owns a house in Ibb, Yemen. He has an educational degree and is an employer. He is applying for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 30 year-old married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a school principle. He has a taxi and drives in the evening. He is hardworking and he doesn`t like to waste his time in useless work.  He applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts for his taxi. He would like to have a house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Abdulmoamn

texts.en: Abdulmoamn is 33 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He owns a house and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has an educational degree and is an employer. He is applying for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 29 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single and has 2 children. For the past 3 years, Ben has been working hard to manage his small business, which is a video and music library. 

To help expand his business, Ben has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more video and music DVDs, and will help Ben to generate greater profits and pay for his medical bills. Ben hopes that in the future he will be able to provide the best services in town. 

Ben is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ben who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy video and music DVDs

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,cebada,trigo y papa,la socia vende en las  diferentes ferias,la socia tarbaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar,el aueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender papa,cebada,trigo y papa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y abonos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working in agriculture.  She has a field where she grows corn, barley, wheat and potatoes that she sells in various street markets.  She works from 8am until 4pm and wants to get ahead by means of this business and see that her children complete their schooling.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell potatoes, barley, wheat and potatoes.  She’s requesting the loan to buy seeds and manure.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela continua dedicandose al negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud,la socia vende de forma independiente a quienes le solicitan como amistades y clientes,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia cada cierto tiempo viaja a Quillabamba para vender su mercaderia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia. 

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas productos naturales para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Mariela continues with her business selling natural health products.  She sells independently to whoever requests them like acquaintances and customers.  She’s been in business for a good length of time and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  Every so often she travels to Quillabamba to sell her merchandise.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She requests the loan to buy more natural products for her business.  She is grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy more natural products to sell.

loans.name: Wariti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, membre du groupe de crédit Wariti. Veuve, femme dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur autodidacte, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 7 enfants. Elle est vendeuse des poissons. Son mari fut décédé inopinément d’une courte maladie. Elle a commencé son business avec un micro crédit  reçu de l’IMF Hekima. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 8eme crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires régressent suite à l’insécurité grandissante dans les zones d’approvisionnement, précisément dans Rutshuru. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 3 paniers de poissons (sales, fumés ou frais). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The borrower, Kavira, is a member of the Wariti credit group. She is a 48-year-old widow with seven children, and also a dynamic and ambitious self-made entrepreneur.  

Kavira sells fish.  Her husband unexpectedly died after a short illness.

Kavira started her business with a micro-loan received from the microfinance institution Hekima.
She uses the profits from her business to put some money into savings, to buy food and to contribute to her children's schooling costs.

She has now just received her eighth loan.  Kavira's business has recently suffered from the increasing level of insecurity in the areas where she gets her supplies, particularly in the town of Rutshuru.

This new loan will be used to buy three baskets of fish (salted, smoked or fresh fish).

Kavira wants to see her children grow.  She would also like to buy a house.
She thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the empowerment of low-income women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of fish (salted, smoked or fresh fish).

loans.name: Eduar Javier

texts.es: Eduar tiene 22 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive con él y su esposa en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Es una persona muy responsable  y emprendedora. Hace más de un año Eduar consiguió un puesto de venta en el mercado local donde alquila, allí estableció su propio negocio donde vende diferentes tipos de celulares y repuestos y además presta el servicio de reparación de celulares. Esta solicitando un préstamo a ODEF por 10,000.00 lempiras, con el cual va comprar repuestos para surtir el negocio ya que tiene buena demanda. Su meta es ver su negocio en crecimiento y también quiere ver crecer a su hijo y ser un padre ejemplar para él.
texts.en: Eduar, 22, is married and has a son; he lives with him and his wife in the town of Masica, Atlántida.  He’s a very responsible, enterprising person.  Over a year ago Eduar acquired a stand in the local market that he leases.  He set up his own business there where he sells various types of mobile phones and spare parts; he also provides mobile phone repair services.  He’s asking ODEF for a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy spare parts to stock the business since demand is good.  His goal is to see his business grow and he also wants to see his son grow and to be an exemplary father to him.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone spare parts.

loans.name: Ngaayise Group

texts.en:
Ngaayise is a group made up of 3 women who sell sandals, vegetables and provisions. Two are married with children while one is single and has no child.  Their ages range between 25 and 40 years. They have been together as a group for 3 years but started taking loans from ID-Ghana in 2011. They are in their third loan cycle. They meet on Friday to discuss business and the repayment of the loan.

Fuastina is 35 years old and sells provisions.  She is married to a 38 year-old carpenter and they have three children who are all in school. She took 250 Ghana cedis in her second loan cycle, which was used to expand the business by buying more sugar, rice, biscuits, milk, milo, etc. She now needs 350 Ghana cedis to also buy a lot of rice, sugar, milk, and milo so that she can meet customers' demand. She completed payment of the previous loan on 20/7/2012 and the profit made was reinvested into the business.

The group needs a total amount of 1050 Ghana cedis.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, biscuits, milk, milo, etc., to sell to customers.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos con su anterior credikiva compró una variedad de pescado y logró así mismo una gran venta. En su negocio él  ha avanzado,  pues ahora tiene un distribuidor de sus productos y también él vende directamente las deliciosas y frescas mojarras y el tan exquisito bocachico abierto y picado.  Su demanda se ha incrementado y necesita invertir cada vez mas,  eso si sobre pedidos, esta es justamente la razón para acudir a un credikiva, pues requiere comprar mojarras, lora, roja que son sus mayores pedidos y su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y lograr mas ingresos.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos por apoyarme y dar la oportunidad de tener experiencias financiera.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Juan Carlos bought a variety of fish and achieved a big sale. He has advanced in his business and now has a distributor of his products and he also sells directly the delicious and fresh bream, and exquisite bocachico, open and chopped. 

His demand has increased and he needs to invest more each time on orders.  This is precisely the reason he is requesting Kiva loan, he wants to buy bream, parrotfish, red fish, which are his biggest orders.  His working capital has become insufficient to increase the volume of his sales and achieve more income. 

His message to Kiva lenders is: "My thanks for supporting me and giving me the opportunity to have financial experience.

loans.use: to buy bream, parrotfish, and red fish, which are his biggest orders.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comuanl SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua dedicandose a su trabajo ,ella trabaja en el area de operaciones en una agencia de viajes,de lunes a sabado,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo gracias al esfuerzo que le pone cada dia ,la socia a la vez cuenta con un pequeño negocio de restaurante siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,uno de los sueños de la socia es que cresca su negocio de restaurante para de esta forma brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.


La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz y aceite.
La socia se siente agradecida por el apoyo que se le otorga y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “San Rafael” communal bank and continues dedicated to her work.  She’s employed in the operations department of a travel agency from Monday to Saturday.  She’s had this job for some time thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.   She also has a small restaurant business which is how she moves her family forward.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person and one of her dreams is that her restaurant business grows so that she can provide better quality of life for her children.

She requests the loan to buy ingredients for the business like rice and oil.  She feels grateful for the support she’s been granted and at the same time commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice and oil.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
El socio Jhonatan pertencece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL,el socio continua brindando el servicio de taxi ,el alquila un auto para realizar su trabajo ,el socio trabaja por horas durante el dia dependiendo a la actividad que pueda realizar durante el dia,el socio a la vez continua alquilando equipos electronicos para los distintos compromisos que le solicitan, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante.


El socio solicita el credito para el mantenimiento de uno de sus equipos electronicos .
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a member of the “San Rafael” communal bank.  He continues providing taxi services.  He leases a car to do his work.  He works during the day and depending on his day job he also leases out electronic equipment for various events he’s contracted for.  He’s a responsible, dedicated person who is moving forward this way.

He requests the loan to service one of his pieces of electronic equipment.  He feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his scheduled payments.

loans.use: to service his electronic equipment.

loans.name: Begimo

texts.ru: Бегимо решила организовать бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Ей 55 лет. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад, и она воспитает дочь одна. Дочери 18 лет. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить дочь с хорошим условием жизни. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Begimo decided to organize a business to improve her family welfare.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  She is 55 years old.  Her husband passed away several years ago, and she raised her daughter by herself.  Her daughter is 18 years old.  Begimo wants to organize a business of buying and selling livestock because she has experience in this type of business.  She plans to use the resulting income to provide her daughter with good living conditions.  Begimo is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to purchase livestock in order to start her new business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to start her new business

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa y trigo,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas y cuyes,la socia tanto los animales como los productos agricolas lo vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales y los productos como papa,maiz y trigo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y abonos y tambien para comprar alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina is still in the agriculture business, she has a plot where she grows corn, potato and wheat, she also raises small animals like chickens and guinea pigs, she sells both her animals and the products of her harvest in the different fairs [around the place she lives]. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.
Marina's dream is to have a shop where she can sell her animals and her produce, things like potatoes, corn and wheat.
Maria requests a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to buy food for the animals. She is very happy because of her loan [has been granted] and she makes herself responsible to pay her loan installments promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, also to buy food for the animals.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dediacndo al negocio de compra y venta de animale como cuyes y pollos,la socia los hace negordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a  pasear,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y pollos y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in her business buying and selling animals like guinea pigs and chicks.  She causes them to fatten up and grow and then sells them in various street markets.  She’s been in business 8 years and likes going out for walks in her free time.  Her dream is to expand the business selling animals.  She’s requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, chicks and animal feed for them.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de palos,ella vende palos a las diferentes personas,la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los palos,la socia se dedica a este negocio 4 años.La socia solicita el credito para comprar palos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues with her business selling boards.  She sells them to various people.  She wants her children to finish their schooling by means of this small business.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell the boards.  She’s been in business four years and is asking for the loan to buy boards.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy boards.

loans.name: Jenel

texts.en:
This is Jenel, who is 32 years old and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he manages his household as he works hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.

Jenel makes and sells rice cakes and rice dishes. These are foods commonly eaten for snacks and sometimes after meal for desserts. He sells it per order, and it is in demand on special occasions and holidays. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like rice, sugar, condiments, and seasonings. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Jenel hopes to grow his business, and he dreams of giving his parents a good life through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients needed in his food business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.ru: Мохбиби 51 года. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Она хочет организовать новый бизнес для обеспечения детей с хорошим условием жизни. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она решила организовать бизнес купле продажей  продуктов питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mohbibi is 51 years old.  She is a widow and has four children.  She wants to start her own business to provide her children with good living conditions.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Associated of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  Mohbibi decided to start a business of buying and selling food products.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase products in order to organize her new business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase products in order to organize her new business

loans.name: Zarragul

texts.ru: Заррагулу 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает в складе и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Заррагул  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одеждой, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zarragul is 35 years old.  She is married and raising three children.  Her husband works at a storage and earns a small salary.  This salary is not sufficient to provide the family with all the necessities.  Zarragul decided to help her husband in order to improve the family's welfare.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Associated of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  Now, she can start her own business and be successful at it.  She wants to organize a business of sewing women's clothing because she has experience in this type of business.  She plans to use the resulting income to provider her children with a good education and high-calorie food products.  Zarragul is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase a sewing machine in order to organize her new business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine in order to organize her new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor used to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El socio Richard pertenece la banco comunal SAN RAFEL,el socio continua dedicandose al negocio de reparar electrodomesticos como televisores,licuadoras,radios entre otros,el socio cuenta con un pequeño taller que se encuentra ubicado en su casa, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia su negocio,el socio trabaja de lunes a viernes durante el dia siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante, el espera poder seguir ahorrando para tener un local propio donde pueda realizar de mejor manera su trabajo.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de repuestos para su negocio.
 El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Richard belongs to the communal bank San Rafael.  He is continuing in his business repairing appliances such as televisions, radios, blenders and other items.  He has a small shop located in his home.  He has been in this business for years, and things are going well thanks to the painstaking effort he puts into his business.  He works from Monday through Friday during the day in order to get ahead.

He hopes he will be able to continue saving and eventually be able to have a proper shop of his own where he can do his work.

He is seeking this loan in order to buy spare parts for his business.  He is thankful and values this loan opportunity, and he promises to make his scheduled repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Lucina Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira es una mujer muy trabajadora y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante y sobre todo por su hijo de 13 años a quien quiere muchísimo y sobre todo por quien da la vida y trabaja muy duro al igual que su esposo por darle una vida mejor a la que tienen actualmente. Edelmira vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee mucha flora y fauna muy bella y sobre todo porque posee paisajes muy bellos con una gastronomía muy variada y deliciosa. Desde pequeña aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente y por ello llego a estudiar la carrera de Educación, cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear con su familia y sobre todo disfrutar junto a ellos de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo y frejoles”.

Con mucha dedicación y sobre todo optimismo Edelmira trabaja cada día como auxiliar de educación en un colegio de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día,  ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque  tiene mucha paciencia con los niños y sobre todo porque es muy responsable.

Edelmira muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá terminar de construir su vivienda ya que podrá comprar materiales como calaminas, clavos, listones, entre otros; de esta manera ella podrá tener una vivienda más segura y sobre todo poder darle una mejor calidad de vida para su hijo, así ella podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a su hijo y obtener su nombramiento en el trabajo”.
texts.en:
Edelmira is a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead especially for her 13-year-old son who she loves very much and would give her life for.  He and her husband work hard to provide a better life than the one they now have.  

Edelmira lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  It also has abundant beautiful flora and fauna especially because its scenery is very beautiful; its cuisine too is varied and delicious.  

She learned to earn her living with the sweat of her brow when still little and succeeded in learning to be a teacher.  When she has free time available she likes going out with her family and especially to enjoy one of their favorite dishes, “Arroz con Pollo y Frejoles,” together.

With much dedication and above all enthusiasm, Edelmira works every day as a teaching assistant in a local school; she works about 9 hours daily.  She believes she does well in her work because she’s very patient with the children and above all because she’s very responsible.

Edelmira is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to finish building her house because she’ll be able to buy supplies like plywood, nails and metal struts, among others.  In this way she will be able to have a more secure house and above all be able to give her son a better quality of life and she will be able to continue striving every day to make her greatest dream a reality: to provide her son with a good profession and to obtain a permanent teaching position.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de leche,la socia saca la leche de los ganados que cria y luego lo vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 6 años,el sueño de la socia es ampliar le negocio de venta de leche y le gustaria tener un local paarq ue pueda vender leche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working in her business buying and selling milk.  She extracts milk from the cows she rises and then sells it in various street fairs and markets.  She works from 7am until 5pm and has been in this business for six years.  Her dream is to expand the milk selling business and she’d like to have a locale in which to sell the milk.  She requests the loan to buy a cow.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL,la socia continua con su negocio de bar karaoke,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia,la socia trabaja en su negocio en la noche desde las 07:00pm aproximadamente,la socia vende cerveza,rones y otras bebidas ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que saca adelante a su familia.



En esta oportunidad la señora Feliciana solicita el credito  para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Feliciana’s a member of the “San Rafael” communal bank and continues with her karaoke bar.  She’s been in business for a good length of time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She works at night from 7pm approximately.  She sells beer, rum and other drinks.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  On this occasion, Feliciana requests the loan to buy beer for the business.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran is 54 years old and married.   She lives in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province.  She has nine children, three of whom are dependents and still in school, while the others have their own employment to support their living. 

To support the big family, she and her husband have been in the fishing business for ten years. The current business earns her family about KHR 16,700 per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Ran has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already.  She successfully used the past loan to better support her family, to have sufficient food and to pay for her children’s education. 

Now she and her group member, who has been with VisionFund for seven cycles, are applying for a loan of KHR 900,000 and KHR 1,200,000, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a power boat for her business. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her current fishing business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions and keep their children in school.

loans.use: To buy a power boat for her business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria pollos,cuyes y patos,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 15 años en este negocio y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus 5 hijos,ella quiere que terminen de estudiar,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar patos,gallinas y cuyes y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Paulina works raising animals; she raises chickens, guinea pigs and ducks.  She fattens them up and makes them grow and then sells them in various street markets.  She’s been in business 15 years and supports her five children this way.  She wants them to finish their schooling and her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her animals.  She requests the loan to buy ducks, chicks and guinea pigs as well as feed for them.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ducks, chickens and guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Avecillas Group

texts.es:
Avecillas son un grupo muy bueno y trabajador, ellas decidieron llamar así al grupo, ya que viven en el sector aves de su colonia. 

La señora Mayra es una de las integrantes del grupo, habita en el municipio de García, N.L. con su esposo y sus 5 hijos.

Mayra y su esposo tienen un puesto de tacos de carne asada llamado “El Moy”, se encuentra en una buena ubicación (sobre la avenida) y como los lunes y viernes hay mercado ahí mismo, esos días trabajan todo el día. El crédito le ayudara a comprar mas producto y de esa forma obtener mas ganancias.

Mayra es una mujer que lucha por lo que quiere y desea seguir trabajando junto a su esposo para sacar adelante su hogar y su negocio.
texts.en:
Avecillas is a very good and hard-working group. They decided on this name for their group as they live in a bird area in their neighbourhood. 

Mayra is one of the members of the group. She lives in the Garcia, N.L municipality with her husband and 5 children. Mayra and her husband have a grilled meat taco stand called “El Moy” which is in a good location (on the street), and since there is a market from Monday to Friday right there, on those days they work all day. The loan will help them to buy more products and therefore earn more profits.

Mayra is a woman who fights for what she wants and she wants to continue working with her husband to get ahead for her home and business.

loans.use: to invest in more products to prepare tacos.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud,la socia vende de forma independiente a sus clientes y amistades que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia desea poder seguir vendiendo su mercaderia y de esta forma seguir creciendo en su negocio,a la vez la socia es enfermera de profesion siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mas productos naturales para su negocio.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorga y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Roxana belongs to the “San Rafael” communal bank and continues with her business selling natural health products.  She sells independently to her customers and acquaintances who request them.  She’s been in this business a good length of time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who wants to continue selling merchandise and thus continue expanding the business.  She’s also a nurse by profession and this is how she supports her family.  She needs the loan to buy more natural products for her business.  She’s grateful for the support provided and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy more natural products to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Julie has requested a loan to buy seeds, tools and fertilizer. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Julie will spend her profits to pay her children's school fees and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, shovels, bush knives, wheel barrow, and gloves.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina se dedica al negocio de venta de maiz y habas,la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra habas y maiz y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es mejorar su terreno de cultivo y de esta manera ampliar sus productos,la socia tambien quiere sembrar papa,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 6 años.La socia solicita le credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sus tierra de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Paulina, earns a living through the business of the sale of corn and broad beans.  The member has a plot of farmland where she sows broad beans and corn and then sells them in different street markets. The members works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. The member’s dream is to improve her plot of farmland and thus increase her products. The member also wants to plant potatoes. The member already has six years’ experience in this business. 

The member is applying for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Tuaialuga

texts.en: Tuaialuga is 25 years old and married with 5 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice pop,t wisties, german buns, donuts in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy food items and some soft drinks to sell in front of their school building. In the future, Tuaialuga hopes to expand her business in the future. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: snacks, donuts, soft drinks, and ice pop.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with one school-aged child. Emily lives in the village of Nappaccu Grande, and she has a retail store near the village school. She has been running her business for three years and earns approximately 650 PHP a day. 

Emily is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy school supplies, bread, condiments, and snacks to sell. Emily is confident that this loan will help her expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, bread, condiments, and snacks for sale.

loans.name: Andal Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADIATA BINGUEL représente le groupe ANDAL. Elle se porte bien. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des bouteilles de gaz et pagnes depuis 03ans. Son crédit passé s’est bien déroulé. Mme est très contente. Elle s’approvisionne à sodigaz pour le gaz et au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les amis voisins.
Elle veut  s’acheter 20 pièces de pagnes 10 complets bazin et 20 bouteilles de gaz.
Mme veut utiliser ses économies pour améliorer son activité et épargner. Elle ambitionne aider à la scolarisation des enfants dont elle a la charge.
texts.en:
Kadiata Binguel is the representative of the ANDAL group.  She is doing well.  She is single and has no children, but she has two persons in her care.

Kadiata has been selling bottled gas and "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) for three years.  She encountered no problem with her previous loan, and she is very happy.  She buys her gas bottles from Sodigaz and also stocks up at the District 10 market.  Her customers are neighbors and friends.

She wants to buy 20 "pagnes", 10 sets of "bazin" (damask) fabrics measuring 1 x 3 m. each, and 20 gas bottles.

Kadiata wants to use her earnings to improve her activity and to save some money.  Her ambition is to contribute to the schooling costs of the children who are in her care.

loans.use: to buy 20 pagnes, 10 sets of "bazin" (damask) fabrics measuring 1 x 3 m. each, and 20 gas bottles.

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en: Siniva is 31 years old and married with 4 children. She would like to start growing cabbages, carrots, and cucumbers to earn a living. Siniva has requested a loan to buy tools and seeds to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Siniva will spend her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheel barrow, and weed killer.

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en: Faleseu is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling local food in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy cooking equipments and everything she needs to start her business. In the future, Faleseu hopes to expand her business and to save more money for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, cooking oil, rice, chicken, and onions.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is a motocycle operator and provides transport services to the people in his village and to nearby communities, too. He is 44 years old, married, and has children attending school. He is now asking for 7,000 PHP to buy tires and gasoline for his motorcycle. He usually earns 3,000 PHP a month.

He hopes to improve his income and provide for his family's needs by continuing to provide safe transport services to all his passengers. In particular, he wants to earn enough to pay school fees for his children and help them succeed professionally in their chosen careers.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
Marlith tiene 53 años de edad, pero tiene la alegría de una joven de 20 años, ella vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, paisajes hermosos, flora y fauna impresionante y sobre todo porque sus pobladores son personas alegres y amables. Desde pequeña Marlith aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, ya que sus padres eran muy humildes, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el segundo grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar costura o diseñador de modas. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos y a la vez típicos de su ciudad el cual es la riquísima “Patarashca de Pescado”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Marlith trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a precios cómodos.

Marlith está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz por sacos, azúcar, fideos al por mayor, entre otros, así como también realizar mejoras en su local, de esta manera ella podrá tener mayor variedad de sus productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, de esa manera ella podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Marlith is 53 years old, but he has the joy of a 20-year-old. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city that is characterized by having a warm climate, beautiful landscapes, impressive flora and fauna, and, above all, because its citizens are cheerful and friendly people. Since she was small, Marlith has learned to earn her bread through the sweat of her brow, since her parents were very humble. So, she could only study up to the second level of secondary school, but she would have liked to study dressmaking or fashion design. When she has a little free time at her disposal, she very much likes to eat one of her favorite dishes typical of her city, which is the very delicious “Fish Patarashca.”

Marlith works enthusiastically in her small grocery store and beverage business. She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 20 customers daily. She believes that her business is going well because she is friendly to the customers and above all because she offers quality products at affordable prices.

Marlith is very thankful to Kiva since, thanks to the help that they have provided, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business like rice by the sackful, sugar, noodles at wholesale, among others, as well as carry out improvements to her shop. This way, she will be able to have a better variety of products to offer to her customers. That way, she will be able to continue fighting each day to make her greatest dream a reality: “To build her house from superior materials.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, among others).

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Mach is a 35-year-old married mother of two dependent children who are still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for six years, and, to better support the family and help earn more income, her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Together, they earn about 20,000 KHR per day and save about 13,000 KHR a day for the future. 

Mach’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid their loan. The first loan helped Mach better support her family members. Mach, who is the leader of the group, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice for her farm and pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to grow healthy rice, and she also hopes to increase her income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice for her farm.

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es:
Alba tiene 43 años y es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno estudia en la escuela fiscal y el otro es mayor de edad. Alba es una mujer luchadora que no se deja vencer por las adversidades ni los problemas que se le presenten. Ella realizo un curso de belleza en la UTM y de allí empezó a trabajar con cosméticos.  Ella empezó ahorrar dinero y decidió comprar cosméticos para hacer limpiezas faciales  y bisutería.

Hace su trabajo en la calle como vendedora de cosméticos ambulante y  en su casa hace las limpiezas faciales y otras  actividades con sus clientes que le piden utilizar los cosméticos. 

El tipo de negocio es belleza cosméticos y bisutería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cremas, perfumes, bisuterías etc.  El sueño de Alba es tener un negocio figo que sea estable poner un bazar y adecuarlos con todas las necesidades del cliente y ser una madre ejemplar inculcándoles valores y principios a sus hijos que ellos sigan ese ejemplo.
texts.en:
Alba is 43 years old and is a single mother. She has two children, of whom one goes to public school and the other is of legal age. Alba is a hard-working woman who does not let herself be overcome by the adversities or the problems that arise for her. She completed a beauty course at UTM (a technical university) and from there began to work with cosmetics. She began to save money and decided to buy cosmetics to do facials and also jewelry to sell.

She makes sales in the street as a walking vendor of cosmetics, and in her home she does facials and provides other services for her customers who ask her to use her cosmetics.

Her type of business is beauty services, cosmetics, and jewelry. With the loan, she wants to buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, etc. Alba's dreams are to have a fixed business place that would be stable, to set it up in a bazaar and outfit it with all the needs of her customers, and to be an exemplary mother, instilling values and principles in her children so that they follow this example.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry, and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Saraem's Group

texts.en:
Saraem is 31 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has three dependent children who are all in school. Rice farming is her family’s only source of income, and Saraem has been in this business for five years. Currently, she earns approximately 21,700 KHR per day and saves about 10,000 KHR each day for the future. 

This is the first micro loan for Saraem’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Saraem, the leader of her group, will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds for her farm. She hopes to increase her current business to improve her income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice for her farm.

loans.name: Bo's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Bo is 62 years old and married with nine children. To make a living and support her big family, Bo and her husband have been farming rice for ten years. Bo supplements this income by selling groceries. 

This is the first micro loan for Bo’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Bo is now leading her group to request a loan of 200,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy rice for her farm. With this loan, she hopes to expand her farming business to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice for her farm.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 40 years old and married with seven children.

Amie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Amie has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running a general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Amie aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Angeles Azules Zona 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa esta viuda, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales no tuvieron la posibilidad de estudiar, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de tortillas de maíz y trigo, en el lugar donde reside, inicio este negocio con la necesidad de tener ingresos para dar un buena condición de vida a su familia, hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara, para la compra de maíz blanco y amarillo, para aumenta su producción tortillas y así mejorar sus ganancias sobre ventas. En el futuro espera tener un negocio amplio y crear fuentes de trabajo para otras personas. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Señora Nicolasa is a widow. She is 48 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has three children for whom it was not possible to go to school. She has a business selling corn and wheat tortillas in the place where she lives. She began this business out of the need to have income to give good living conditions to her family. Up to now she has had three years of experience.

She organized a group and is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase white and yellow corn to increase her production of tortillas and thus improve her profits on sales. In the future she wants to have an expanded business and create sources of work for other people. The other members of the group work in business.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: La Sra.  Jacqueline tiene 34 años tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante que se encuentra en la zona central de la ciudad de El Alto este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jacqueline va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para la ampliación de su restaurante y así  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Jacqueline  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una cadena de restaurantes y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Jacqueline es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Jacqueline is 34 years old. She has two children, aged 12 and 9. Her work is selling food in her restaurant, which is located in the central area of the city of El Alto. This loan is her second sequence with the institution. Jacqueline will use this loan to buy tables and chairs to expand her restaurant, and thus to provide greater comfort to her customers. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Jacqueline will take advantage of the benefits from this to continue buying supplies and thus improving her income. Her desire for her business is to have a chain of restaurants, and thus to provide better service to her clientele. Jacqueline is a very hard-working person, and she feels happy about the opportunity provided to her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 27-year-old married woman who has four family members and is from Jarash, Jordan. 

She is requesting a loan of JD 500 to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to do maintenance and repainting of the home. In the future, she hopes to increase her living standard.

Since Diana is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elvie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elvie has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 45 years old and married with four children. Marilyn has a stall in the market, where she sells a variety of fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 20 years. She usually earns about 2,500 PHP a week. 

Marilyn needs to earn more money to provide a good education for her children. She has insufficient funds, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy tomatoes, squash, string beans, onions, garlic, bananas, and ripe mangoes for sale. These additional fruits and vegetables would help increase her sales and boost her profits. In the future, she wants to provide a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to buy produce for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel tiene 34 años y es casado con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de un año, el se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza en su puesto fijo que se encuentra por la zona de Pampahasi este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Daniel  va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para su negocio productos de limpieza por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es un incremento en los pedidos de sus clientes, El Sr. Daniel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, el va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su capital y sus ventas regulares, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda mucho más grande y más surtida.
texts.en: Daniel is 34 years old and married with 1 child, who is one year old. His work is selling cleaning products from his sales stand located in the Pampahasi zone. This loan is his first sequence within the institution. Daniel will use this loan to buy merchandise for his business, purchasing cleaning products on a wholesale basis. His reason for requesting this loan is an increase in orders from his customers. Daniel faces challenges in his business such as the competition. He will use the benefits from this loan to increase his capital and his regular sales. His desire for his business is to have a much larger store stocked with more products.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for vehicles to sell.

loans.name: Gulam's Group

texts.en:
Gulam is 50 years old and is a hardworking and independent widow. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her two daughters and two sons. After her husband's death, she has worked very hard. All of her children are married and living separately, while she is living with her younger son. She is currently facing a water problem in her house and she wants to resolve it very soon. 

For 15 years she has been running a general store and a shoe shop. Gulam, a member of an eight-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some materials for her general store like food items, stationery, etc. She wants to invest some of the loan amount in her shoe shop as well.  

With the profit, she wants to open a new mobile shop in the future. Her biggest dream in life is to go for an Umrah (pilgrimage). She is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase some materials like food items and stationery for her general store.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 49, married, and has two school-age children. She is married to a farmer and they live happily in a village where they are able to plant rice, fruits, and vegetables for sale. Due to financial difficulty, Rosana engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

They planned to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. In this regard, Rosana aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate income and support the education of their children. She is requesting an additional loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. 

She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to work out her plans and hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a hog raiser and had been in the business for over 10 years now. She is already 59 years old but is still a workaholic. She is married and has three children who have their own families and live separately from her. She raises hogs and sells them for profits. She earns 3,000 PHP for each hog. Angelina is now borrowing 6,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. This will ensure good nutrition for the hogs so she can sell them at a profitable price. 

Someday, she hopes to increase her income and save funds to use in case of emergencies, especially as she and her husband are getting older.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Moeuk's Group

texts.en:
Moeuk is aged 45 years and married with four children living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, which they have been in for ten years. The current business earns them about 29,000 KHR per day and allows them to save about 7,000 KHR each day for  future needs.

Moeuk’s group consists of three female members who have been members of VisionFund for one cycle. Moeuk successfully used the first loan to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Yolanda has been farming rice for 2 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nge's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, Nge is a 44-year-old married mother of two children, a boy and a girl, who have their own jobs. She and her husband have earned a living by farming rice for ten years. To better support the family, she raises pigs and sells groceries. She earns about 64,000 KHR a day, and she manages to save about 9,000 KHR for the future. 

This is a group loan for Nge’s group. Nge has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Past loans have helped Nge to better support her family and expand her business. Nge, the leader of her group, will use her portion of the requested loan to buy fertilizers for her farm and use a portion of it to buy pig feed and groceries for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business and make more income to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: La Sra.  Estela tiene 54 años, es casada tiene 5 hijos de las edades de  36, 35, 25,23 y 20 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y pescados fritos que es su especialidad, ella se dedica a esta actividad ya hace varios años tiene su tienda que se encuentra en la zona de el Tejar de la ciudad de la Paz,  este préstamo es su octava  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Estela es cliente antigua de la institución no tiene problemas en el pago de sus cuotas es muy responsable, la Sra. Estela  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un puesto de venta  y ampliar su negocio y así  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Estela  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Estela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada desde que comenzó con su actividad.
texts.en: Señora Estela is 54 years old. She is married and has five children, ages 36, 35, 25, 23, and 20. She sells food and fried fish, which is her specialty. She has already been working in this business for a number of years. She has her store in the El Tejar zone of the city of La Paz. This loan is her eighth one with this institution. Sra. Estela is an old client of the institution. She does not have problems with her loan payments. She is very responsible. Sra. Estela is going to use this loan to buy a sales stand to expand her business and in this way offer better convenience to her customers. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving in her business. Sra. Estela is going to use the earnings to continue buying supplies and thus improving her income. Sra. Estela is a very hard-working person. She feels happy about the opportunities that have been offered her since she began her business.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a sales stand in the El Tejar district

loans.name: Jose Rudy

texts.es:
José, hoy en dia, administra a parte del taller, una venta de frutas y verduras al mayoreo, transportandose para  otras zonas de venta, él necesita otro crédito para continuar trabajando con la venta de  frutas al  como lo es: mango, tamarindo, guineo, etc; el motivo de solicitar otro préstamo es porque necesita invertir más y mejorar las ventas.
El crédito anterior fue de gran ayuda ya que le permitió invertir en el taller comprandose las herramientas necesaria para trabajar, sus circunstancias han cambiado, los familiares económicamente están mejor.
texts.en:
Currently, José is managing his workshop part-time and also selling fruits and vegetables on a wholesale basis. He travels to other areas to make his sales. He needs another loan to continue working with the fruit selling business, buying fruits such as mangoes, tamarind, bananas, etc. His reason for requesting another loan is that he needs to invest more and improve his sales. 

The previous loan was of great help to him, since it allowed him to invest in his workshop, buying the tools he needed for his work. His circumstances have improved, and his family is doing better economically.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, tamarind, bananas and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Sila's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Sila is 31 years old and married. She has four children, who are all dependents, and one of them is in school while the others are too young. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for six years, and they supplement the family’s income by growing vegetables. They currently earn about 23,600 KHR a day and manage to save about 13,600 KHR for the future. 

This is the third micro loan for Sila’s group, which consists of three female members. She completely repaid her past two loans, which have helped her improve her standard of living. She is now leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. She wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm and buy a water pump to supply water for her farm. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Pak's Group

texts.en:
Pak is 51 years old and married with five children, two of whom are dependents. She lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for fifteen years. Lack of working capital is a main challenge for her family’s business. 

Pak’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles already and completely paid back the loans, while her group co-member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. 

The past loans have helped her family with sufficient food and better support the business. Currently, she can earn about 36,000 KHR per day from the business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. 

She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 52 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Antonieta is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Antonieta has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from rice and charcoal retail.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gladis Melva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua con su negocio de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos,pinturas,herramientas,tubos y materiales de construccion como cemento entre otros,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como cemento.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gladis belongs to the communal bank SAN RAFAEL. She continues with her hardware business. She sells nails, paint, tools, tubes and construction materials such as cement among others. She has spent years in this business which is going well, thanks to the hard work she puts in everyday. Her business is located in her house. Gladis is a responsible and hard working person and being this way she gets her family ahead.

Gladis is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise for her business such as cement. She is very grateful for the loan granted and she promises to honour the established monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy hardware for her business such as cement.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Despite hardships, Carlos is determined to become successful in the future. He is 53 years old and has only one child. He has been a farmer for almost 22 years, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. He also engages in hog-raising to generate additional income. He aims to improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future. 

Carlos plans to raise more pigs to sell in his community, but he does not have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of 21,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and piglets to raise. This financial assistance will enable him to improve his business, allowing him to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and piglets.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El Sr. Justo es soltero y vive en la ciudad de Encarnación. Él tiene un Local de venta de Baterías en General en el centro de Encarnación.
El nos comenta que gracias al los créditos recibidos de la fundación ha podido ir creciendo en su  Micro Empresa y así ayudar con los gastos del día a día de su hogar.
Justo solicita el crédito para la compra de baterías de todas las marcas, para que de esa forma pueda surtir su negocio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Sr. Justo is single and lives in the city of Encarnación. He has a shop in central Encarnación where he sells batteries.

Justo says that thanks to the loans he has received from Fundación Paraguaya, he has been able to grow his micro-enterprise. This helps him to cover his daily household expenses.

Justo is requesting a loan in order to buy batteries of all brands so that he can restock his business and continue working.

loans.use: to buy batteries to sell.

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Sinuon is 54 years old and married with five children; four of them are married, while one daughter is single and helps in the family’s business. Sinuon has been a rice farmer for 20 years, and she supplements her family’s income by raising pigs and selling groceries in the local area. Her husband is a local doctor. Sinuon earns about 41,000 KHR a day and saves about 20,000 for the future. 

Sinuon, the leader of her group, has been with VisionFund for two cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund from two to three cycles. Past loans, which Sinuon completely repaid, have helped her better support her family and earn sufficient working capital for her business. Sinuon he wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm, pig feed, and more grocery items for her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Cuauhtémoc Group

texts.es: El señor Raúl tiene 54 años de edad y es soltero, dice que  el es parte de un grupo llamado “Cuauhtémoc” y dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que así se llama la calle donde se reúnen semana con semana para hacer sus cobranzas. Dice que él tiene un negocio de abarrotes y lo tiene en su casa desde hace mas de 40 años, dice que su papa fue quien lo puso para poder sacar adelante a su familia y que cuando su papa falleció el se hizo cargo del negocio. Comenta que desde hace como 15 años el está al frente de su negocio y que él lo valora mucho ya que con mucho esfuerzo su papa lo hizo crecer y ahora él quiere mantenerlo y así poder ayudar a su mama. Platica que está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera a Visión Fund para la compra de jabón, azúcar, leche, café, huevo aunque no ha surtido ya que no ha comprado por que se elevo mucho su precio pero tiene que tener en existencia ya que en México es el primer consumidor de este alimento. También comprara papel higiénico, pañales, shampoo, pasta dental, sopas instantáneas, cloro etc. platica que todo eso lo comprara en diferentes tiendas de su población. La meta que tiene don Raúl es volver a tener bien surtido su negocio ya que el quisiera que sus sobrinos nunca dejaran decaer el negocio familiar. Los otros nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman Dulce María, Raquel, Zerafina, Erika Jazmín, María Guadalupe, María del Carmen, María Guadalupe, Noemi y Roció, ellas invertirán en sus diferentes negocios como en compra de pan para después venderlos por las casas, invertir en ropa de dama para vender, invertirlo en abono para cultivo de chayote y después venderlos, comprara en diferentes tipos de perfumes para su venta, invertirá en un estacionamiento público, compraran plásticos para venta, venta de cosméticos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl is 54 years old and single. He says that he is a member of the group called “Cuauhtémoc” and that the name was chosen because it is the street where they meet each week to submit their payments. Raúl says that he has a grocery business located in the house where he has lived for more than 40 years. He says that his father started the business so that their family could get ahead. When his father died, he took charge of the business. Raúl says that he has been managing the front of the store since he was 15 years old. He appreciates the effort his father invested to grow the business that he now maintains with the help of his mother.

Raúl says he is requesting a loan from Vision Fund (FRAC) so that he can buy soap, sugar, milk, coffee, and eggs since he is not stocked with these items. He has not bought much because of the increase in prices, but he needs to have these products in stock since they are basic necessities in Mexico. He will also buy toilet paper, diapers, shampoo, toothpaste, instant soups, bleach, and other products. Raúl says that he buys all of his merchandise from different stores in his village. His goal is to return to having a well-stocked business because he wants to pass this family enterprise on to his nieces and nephews.

The other nine members of the group are Dulce María, Raquel, Zerafina, Erika Jazmín, María Guadalupe, María del Carmen, María Guadalupe, Noemi, and Rocío. They will invest their loans in their various businesses such as buying bread to sell from home, investing in women’s clothing to sell, investing in compost for growing chayote squash to sell, buying different types of perfumes to sell, investing in a public parking lot, buying plastic goods to sell, and selling cosmetics through catalogs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products in the sale of fuel.

loans.name: Dúo Visión De Fe Group

texts.es:
Dúo  Visión  de fe.
Doña Haydee es originaria de Colonia Santa Otilia Chimaltenango, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos que están en edad escolar  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y chiles rellenos, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de maíz ya que lo necesita comprar por mayor para que se lo den más barato, el sueño de ella es tener un local ya que por momento su venta lo tiene en su casa, espera que por medio del ustedes otorgándole el crédito ella pueda seguir y no solo seguir luchando si no ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Vision of Faith Group

Doña Haydee is originally from the neighborhood of Santa Otilia Chimaltenango. She is married and has four children who are of school age. Haydee prepares and sells tortillas and stuffed chile peppers. She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn in bulk so that she can get a cheaper price.

Her dream is to have a shop since she currently sells from her house. Haydee hopes that with the loan being provided, she will be able to continue her efforts and also expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es: David,  tiene 31 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. el tiene su propia fuente de ingresos, hace 3 años estableció un pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, churros, dulces, galletas, pan, refrescos y otros como repuestos para bicicletas y motocicletas. Con ODEF lleva cinco prestamos, el actual es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas repuestos de bicicletas y motocicletas, esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos. Tiene como meta ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darles una buena educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en: David is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He lives in the municipality of Tela, in the department of Atlántida.  He has his own source of income, which is a grocery store business that he started up 3 years ago.  In his store, he sells consumer staples such as rice, beans, sugar, butter, churros, sweets, cookies, bread, beverages, and other products such as spare parts for bikes and motorcycles.  He has taken 5 loans with ODEF; the current loan is for 21,000 Honduran lempiras.  He will invest this loan in the purchase of more spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles.  This investment will help him to increase his income.  His goal is to save money so that he can build his own house and also provide a good education to his children.

loans.use: to stock his business with products to sell such as spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en: Togtohbayar is 57 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in Huvsgui province, Mongolia. His wife, Doljin, is 53 years old. She is retired and is living on a pension. Togtohbayar worked as a driver for a cargo company for 20 years. He has also been on a pension for the last 3 years and now he wants to start a local cargo service. He is a hardworking and experienced man. He's planning to purchase a track trailer to start his new business and is requesting 2 000 000 MNT for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase a track trailer.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Gloria,  tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su esposo y una hija quien estudia en el colegio actualmente.
Doña gloria trabajo muchos años como cocinera en una empresa privada, y hace 9 meses decidió por tener su propio negocio y estableció una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, desinfectantes, productos enlatados, harina, condimentos, churros, refrescos etc. ella quiere tener surtido su negocio y ha solicitado un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras para la compra de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles para vender. Ella espera incrementar su clientela y sus ganancias. Y tiene como meta seguir trabajando para que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en: Gloria, 54, lives in the municipality of Tela in the province of Atlántida with her husband and a daughter who is currently in school.  Gloria has worked for many years as a cook in a private company.
